summary: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List showing Jeffrey Epstein's international travel history from 1997 to 2000, including flight details, dates, times, and arrival/departure locations. The document was generated in 2021 but records travel events from the late 1990s.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The sole individual listed in this travel record, showing multiple international flights between 1997 and 2000.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein had 21 recorded international travel encounters between 1997 and 2000 according to this CBP TECS record.
Frequent travel patterns show Epstein regularly flew between New York (JFK) and London (LHR) on British Airways flights.
The document shows Epstein traveled to Paris (CDG) on Air France on May 30, 1998.
Multiple entries show travel through Palm Beach International Airport (inspection type A523) and Cyril E. King International Airport (A511).
The document was generated on September 21, 2021, but contains historical travel data from the late 1990s, indicating ongoing law enforcement review of Epstein's travel history.
